info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:26AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Whiteside County through 445 AM CDT... At 425 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Emerson, or near Sterling, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sterling, Rock Falls, Morrison, Emerson, Union Grove, Round Grove, Yeoward Addition, Whiteside County Airport, Galt, Penrose, Malvern, Como, White Pigeon, Morrison-Rockwood State Park, Whiteside County Fairgrounds, Grimes Addition, Douglas Park, Unionville and Agnew. This includes Interstate 88 between mile markers 30 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
